articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Hana Music Information Center
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Hana Music Information Center

					Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the Hana Music Information Center.
					
					 The center situated in Thongil Street is an integrated base for art information which collects, edits and disseminates data on music and dance of Korea and other countries. 
					
					 Touring e-library on music, multiplexer appreciation room and other parts of the center, leader Kim Jong Il learnt about its construction and management. 
					
					 He noted with high appreciation that the center has been wonderfully built to show the modern sense of beauty by decorating its exterior with stone through dry construction method and ensuring effective internal building in a versatile way. 
					
					 He was also pleased to see the modernly equipped e-library on music built to suite the individual characters of experts in music and dance and amateurs.
					
					 At the multiplexer appreciation room furnished with modern stereo sound facilities, he personally listened to music and said that the room has been well designed enough to give such effect that anyone can feel himself or herself enjoying music in a theater. 
					
					 In order to run the center in an effective way, he said, it is important above all to collect a lot of art pieces including Korean music and world famous music. 
					
					 The center should have all materials and data on art such as records of new songs, sheets of music and books on music and dance published in the country, he urged. Adding that he would offer all of the music pieces, systematically collected by him over the past decades of guidance over the revolution and construction, he called for inputting them for the people to widely enjoy and use them. 
					
					 He went round the production site of the Hana Electronic Joint Venture Company arranged on the second floor of the center. 
					
					 Touring various parts of the site, he acquainted himself in detail with production capacity and variety and quality of products. 
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the company has produced many various kinds of articles for cultural use after building the production process of electronic products with an annual capacity of hundreds of thousands of products. 
					
					 Watching DVDs being fitted in the streamline process, he said that products are of high quality and very perfect. 
					
					 In particular, portable DVD with function of TV is well designed, he said. 
					
					 After learning about the research and development of new electronic products, he praised the exceptionally creative spirit of the company officials and employees who are dynamically waging the drive to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology. 
					
					 Daily growing is the demand of the Korean people for cultural articles including DVDs, he said, urging the company to produce various kinds of electronic products in a larger quantity. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK; Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., WPK; Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC; Pak To Chun, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK; Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., WPK; Ri Jae Il, first vice department director of the C.C., WPK; and Kwon Hyok Bong, vice department director of the C.C., WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Kwangbok Area Supermarket
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Kwangbok Area Supermarket 

					Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Kwangbok Area Supermarket just before opening.
					
					 Kwangbok Department Store which was originally completed in October 1991 has been renovated as a supermarket thanks to the initiative and great loving care shown by Kim Jong Il being considerate of the people's well-being and improvement of their living standard.
					
					 The supermarket is a commercial service base capable of providing every convenience for the customers with accurate and rapid service as all of its management activities have been put on IT and digital basis ranging from warehousing to selling. 
					
					 With the total floor space of more than 12 700 square meters, the three-storey supermarket has counters filled with household appliances and electronic goods, such foodstuff as confectionery, milk, tea, soy sauce, soybean paste and oil and such textile goods as children's clothes, toys, Korean dresses, towels, quilts and undergarment.
					
					 Going round counters on each floor, Kim Jong Il learned in detail about the varieties of goods, state of display and sales plan.
					
					 Saying that the supermarket is fitted with display cases, stands and tools and other facilities and furnishings needed for the storage and sales of goods to cater for the tastes of consumers, he expressed great satisfaction over the successful renovation of the commercial service center to be conducive to improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 The renovation has made it possible to satisfy the increasing demand of the people for goods, he noted.
					
					 He, calling for meeting the people's need in any case, saw to it that necessary measures were taken.
					
					 He set forth tasks facing the supermarket in its service.
					
					 Noting that the essence of the socialist commerce is to orientate all its activities to serving the people, to all intents and purposes, he urged the relevant units to conduct supply service from the stand of looking after the people's life with responsibility and ensure timely sale of goods urgently required by the people so as to provide convenience for their living.
					
					 He went on to say:
					
					 It is the firm will and determination of the Party to provide the people with things best. Officials should become true servants for the people, who provide them with good things first and worry about their life before anything else.
					
					 He underscored the need to strive to supply goods to the people before putting them in foreign markets.
					
					 Accompanying him were Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Pak To Chun and Choe Ryong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, and Ri Jae Il, Pak Pong Ju and Han Kwang Sang, first vice department directors of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of World Peace Federation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of World Peace Federation 

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a cordial talk with a delegation of the World Peace Federation led by President Moon Hyung Jin at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Greetings to King of Bahrain
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Bahrain
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Sheikh Hamad Bin Isa alÔºçKhalifa, king of Bahrain, on its national day.
					
					 Kim in his message sincerely wished the King happiness in good health and great successes in his work to promote the social stability and unity and bring about the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greeting to Bahraini FM
articles.content:
Greeting to Bahraini FM

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Sheikh Khalid Bin Ahmed Bin Mohamed Al-Khalifa, foreign minister of Bahrain on its national day.
					
					 The message wished the Bahraini Foreign Minister great success in the work for the development of external relations, expressing belief that the friendly ties between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Electronics Industrial Working Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
Electronics Industrial Working Delegation Leaves for China

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A DPRK electronics industrial working delegation led by Han Kwang Bok, vice-premier and concurrently minister of Electronics Industry, left here Thursday to visit China.
					
					 On the same day, the delegation of the Russian Aerial Transport Administration led by Director Neradiko Alexandr went back home.

articles.title: Croatia to Steadily Develop Ties with DPRK
articles.content:
Croatia to Steadily Develop Ties with DPRK
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The Croatian government will continue to develop the relations with the DPRK in politics, economy and other fields, said President Ivo Josipovic of this country on Dec. 8 when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador Kim Son Gyong.

articles.title: Anniversary of Creation of Korean-style Economic Management System Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Creation of Korean-style Economic Management System Marked
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A national meeting took place at the Taean Heavy Machine Complex Thursday to mark the 50th anniversary of the creation of the Taean Work System by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, Thae Jong Su, party officials and administrative and economic officials, officials and labor innovators in Nampho City and the complex and working people.
					
					 Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C, Workers' Party of Korea, made a report at the meeting.
					
					 The Taean Work System created by the President in December 1961 was a historic event as it provided an epochal turn in consolidating the economic system in the DPRK and displaying the advantage of socialism in all aspects to triumphantly advance the people's cause of independence, the socialist cause, the reporter said.
					
					 The system, a model of the socialist economic management most correctly reflecting the requirements of the law governing the development of socialist economy, serves as a revolutionary banner that should be strictly maintained in all fields of the national economy in the whole period of socialist construction, he said, and went on:
					
					 The revolutionary essence of this system is that it is the Korean-style work system which applied the immortal Juche idea and the WPK's mass line based on it in economic management.
					
					 It is mainly characterized by man-centered economic management system, the people-centered economic management system that makes it possible for the popular masses to become the true masters of economic management and operate economy in a responsible manner.
					
					 The DPRK has turned into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence. This is a brilliant result of the distinguished and tested leadership of Kim Il Sung who created the Juche-based economic management system and thoroughly applied it in all realms of social life.
					
					 His idea on the Juche-based economic management and feats have been creditably carried forward and developed under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The reporter stressed the need to continue to direct big efforts to running the economy in a rational way suited to the socialist principle and people's interests strictly from the Juche-based stand.

articles.title: Foreign Women Pay Homage to Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Foreign Women Pay Homage to Kim Jong Suk
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Women of embassies of different countries and missions of international bodies here visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Thursday to lay a wreath before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, on her 94th birth anniversary.
					
					 They placed before the bust the wreath carrying their deep reverence for her and paid a silent tribute to her.

articles.title: Foreign Women Visit Pyongyang Textile Mill
articles.content:
Foreign Women Visit Pyongyang Textile Mill 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Women at embassies of various countries and missions of international organizations here Thursday visited the Pyongyang Textile Mill with the approach of the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero. 
					
					 They toured different production processes of the mill. 
					
					 At the end of the visit Jin Yanqiu, wife of the Chinese ambassador, said:
					
					 We were deeply moved to visit the mill on the occasion of the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk. 
					
					The mill is associated with the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 They worked heart and soul to provide people with better clothes. 
					
					 The feats of Kim Jong Suk are shining like a star in the hearts of the Korean people. 
					
					 I hope that officials and workers of the mill would make bigger successes in production. 
					
					 Iliana Almaguer Rodriguez, wife of the Cuban ambassador, said that she was moved to witness the signal progress made by the textile mill in solving the clothing problem under the deep care of the peerlessly great persons. The production capacity of its Tetron rayon fabrics shop is very high, she said, hoping that the workers of the mill would continue to make steady improvement in production. 
					
					 Nguyen Thi Loi, wife of the Vietnamese ambassador, said:
					
					 The mill is associated with the sacred traces left by Kim Jong Suk for the people. I was deeply moved to see the workers keeping the production going at a high rate while working miracles and feats.
					
					 We hope that the mill would turn out cloth and various kinds of textures in a larger quantity for people.

articles.title: Preview of Feature Film "Wishes" Held
articles.content:
Preview of Feature Film "Wishes" Held

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The Korean Film Studio recently produced feature film "Wishes". 
					
					 The film is based on the solo play "Wishes" which was highly appreciated at the second-term fourth contest of art squads of servicepersons' families of the Korean People's Army. It has great significance in cognitive education. 
					
					 A preview of the film took place at the People's Palace of Culture Thursday. 
					
					 It was enjoyed by Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and other senior party and state officials, officials of the armed forces bodies, ministries and national institutions, and creators, artistes, journalists and editors in the fields of culture and art and mass media and officials in Pyongyang. 
					
					 It is based on a true life story of servicepersons who took part in the construction of the Huichon Power Station and their families. It gives ideological and artistic portrayal of the greatest wishes of the Korean people who uphold General Secretary Kim Jong Il as the father of a big family. It also tells how to live and work to have those wishes come true. 
					
					 It impressively shows the unanimous desire of all the people of the country to have pictures taken with Kim Jong Il to keep them as their eternal family photographs.

articles.title: Many Economic Achievements Made in DPRK This Year
articles.content:
Many Economic Achievements Made in DPRK This Year
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has made tremendous achievements in economic sectors this year.
					
					 The builders of the Huichon Power Station finished projects of large dams in some 700 days, which would have taken more than ten years, and completed the project of waterway tunnel extending tens of kilometers.   
					
					 The construction of apartment buildings is in full swing in the Mansudae area in Pyongyang. 
					
					 A 26-storeyed building took shape less than four months after its groundbreaking in May this year and a 45-storeyed building 89 days after the completion of its groundwork. 
					
					 It has taken only 30 hours on an average to build a story.
					
					 A fresh economic upsurge has been registered in South Hamgyong Province. 
					
					 The February 8 Vinalon Complex has built modern production processes to mass-produce quality vinalon fiber, while the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex completed in a short span of time the first-stage gasification project for producing fertilizers with raw materials and fuel available in the country.
					
					 The Taehung Youth Hero Mine started producing magnesia clinker and light burned magnesia with locally available fuel, instead of cokes, and the Ryongyang Mine has taken on a new look suitable to the features of the Songun (military-first) era.
					
					 The Ryongsong Machine Complex successfully made modern geothermal equipment in some 100 days.
					
					 The builders of Tanchon Port completed the project of breakwater extending a thousand and several hundred meters, which would have taken more than ten years, in less than two years under unfavorably physiographical conditions.
					
					 What the people of South Hamgyong Province have done is encouraging all other people throughout the country to work hard for the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Korean Nation Keeps Winter Solstice Day
articles.content:
Korean Nation Keeps Winter Solstice Day

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Traditionally, the Korean people have significantly observed the winter solstice day.
					
					 Until the end of Koryo Kingdom (early 10th century-late 14th century), they had considered it as the year-beginning day and enjoyed themselves on the day. They also made calendars with the day as the first day.
					
					 The winter solstice day has continued to be observed by the Korean nation as "little New Year's Day".
					
					 As the last of the 24 seasonal divisions, it falls on around the 22nd of December each year.
					
					 Its daytime is the shortest and the nighttime the longest in the year.
					
					 Taking rice and red-bean porridge that day is a traditional custom of the Korean people.
					
					 Eating the porridge, they recollect the outgoing year. And they share the porridge with neighbors to promote harmony with each other.

articles.title: Army Song "At a Breath"
articles.content:
Army Song "At a Breath" 

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The army song "At a Breath" enjoyed great popularity in the art performance given recently by company soldiers who distinguished themselves at the 35th servicepersons' art festival.  
					
					 The song, written by Yun Tu Gun, represents the matchless grit and courage of the soldiers of the Korean People's Army.  
					
					 The song is full of the soldiers' spirit of defeating any invaders at one stroke. It also sings of the soldiers creditably discharging their missions.
					
					 Characterized by a martial and light melody, the song serves as a good example in creating songs in the Songun (military-first) era.
					
					 Revolutionary army songs began to be created in Korea along with the founding of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, the first genuine armed forces of the Korean people. They include "Korean People's Revolutionary Army" and "Guerrilla March".
					
					 Many army songs were created later, encouraging the army and the people in their efforts for defending the nation and achieving its prosperity.

articles.title: Bust of Revolutionary Poet Erected in DPRK
articles.content:
Bust of Revolutionary Poet Erected in DPRK
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A bust of Ri Chan, a revolutionary poet, was erected at the Hamnam Ilbo Wednesday.
					
					 Ri Chan was born in Pukchong County before liberation of the country. After graduating from a secondary school he worked as a poet and a member of the Korea Artista Proleta Federation. 
					
					 He vigorously conducted progressive literary activities by creating lyric poems in praise of the might of the anti-Japanese armed struggle led by President Kim Il Sung and the people who turned out in the struggle against the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule. 
					
					 After the liberation of Korea he displayed his creative talent to the full. When he was received by Kim Il Sung in April 1946 he recited ode "A Song in Praise of General Kim Il Sung" with deep emotion to move the people in the presence. 
					
					 Later he wrote many words of songs and poems in praise of the leader such as "Song of General Kim Il Sung", an immortal revolutionary hymn reflecting all Koreans' boundless reverence and thus encouraged their struggle and made signal contribution to the development of literature. 
					
					 Under the care of the Workers' Party of Korea he enjoyed a worthwhile life as an official of the people's power body, editor-in-chief of Hamnam Ilbo and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Unions of Art and Literature of Korea. 
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il put forward Ri Chan as a revolutionary poet who created many poems excellent in ideological and artistic value and saw to it that his bust was built.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Full Play to Advantage of Socialist Economic Management System
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Full Play to Advantage of Socialist Economic Management System

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- All the people should give full play to the advantage of the Juche-oriented socialist economic management system under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday makes this call in an editorial dedicated to the 50th anniversary of the Taean Work System created by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The President created the Taean System, model of the socialist economic management, in the early 1960s when the socialist system was established and the overall technical modernization of the national economy was progressing in the DPRK.
					
					 This system is the advantageous Korean-style socialist economic management that embodies the Juche idea and the revolutionary mass line based on it.
					
					 It helps conduct all the business activities under the collective guidance of party committees and rouse the popular masses to the implementation of economic tasks by giving priority to political affairs. The system also makes it possible for the superior to help the lower in a responsible manner and to closely combine the science and technology with production and turn the economic lever into good account in order to ensure the production in a rational way. 
					
					 It is the people-centered economic management system, whereby the popular masses manage and run the economy in a scientific and rational way as the true masters of its management, and the socialist economic management system that embodies the collective principle of "One for all and all for one!" This is essential character of the Taean Work System and herein lies the source of its inexhaustible might.
					
					 The past five decades after establishment of the system are a glorious and immortal history in which the socialist economy of the DPRK hewed out the original path of its development under the leadership of the great leader and the great party and the Korean people have wrought epoch-making miracles in the economic construction while overcoming all sorts of trials and challenges.
					
					 The editorial calls upon all the people to solve any problem arising in the economic activities in a Korean way suited to intrinsic nature of socialist society, with clear awareness that the victory of socialism is just victory of the revolutionary principle.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Warned against Military Provocations: Minju Joson
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Warned against Military Provocations: Minju Joson 

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers fired on Monday thousands of shells into the waters off the western Paekryong Island and southeastern Yonphyong Island with K-9 self-propelled artillery pieces and other firearms. Both islands lie south of the "northern limit line".
					
					 Calling the shelling drill a "regular training", they argued that it is aimed to "review performance of weapons".
					
					 Minju Joson Thursday observes in this regard in a bylined commentary:
					
					 The drill is a belligerent move running counter to the desire of all Koreans for the improved north-south relations, the commentary says, adding it is an undisguised revelation of their anti-DPRK war hysteria that has reached extremes. 
					
					 The alleged "regular drill" is sophism to cover up their true colors as war maniacs as it was staged with huge armed forces involved in the area where tensions run highest.
					
					 The ulterior aim sought by them is to create circumstances similar to that of the Yonphyong Island shelling incident and find an excuse to provoke a war against the DPRK.
					
					 Instead of drawing lessons from the Yonphyong Island incident, the south Korean warlike forces blared that they would "counterattack not only bases of provocations but commanding posts and backup forces that can mount additional attacks".
					
					 Their anti-DPRK war moves getting serious with each passing day stoke the tensions of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 If they dare fire even a single shell into the inviolable territorial sea, air and land of the DPRK, the deluge of fire of the Yonphyong Island will lead to that of Chongwadae.
					
					 They should not run amuck, mindful that the DPRK's warning is by no means an empty talk.

articles.title: Authorities' Anti-DPRK Moves Accused
articles.content:
Authorities' Anti-DPRK Moves Accused

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations in south Korea staged the 147th action for independent reunification and peace outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Dec. 13 to protest the puppet group of traitors' moves for confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 They referred to the fact that the Ministry of Defense has planned to install light towers at the places from which areas under the control of the DPRK are visible and conduct anti-DPRK psychological warfare on a large scale from Dec. 23.
					
					 The military authorities are raising a hue and cry over "provocation" from someone and inciting confrontation in order to enforce the psychological warfare, they charged.
					
					 Lurking behind this psychological warfare is a scheme to calm down the wrath of the people at the coercive passage of the "motion calling for ratification of the Free Trade Agreement", cyber attack, etc., the organizations said.
					
					 They warned that the authorities would be to entirely blame for the consequences to be entailed by such behavior.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Not Redeeming Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Not Redeeming Its Past Crimes 

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The council for the solution of the issue of the volunteers corps in south Korea issued a statement on December 9 denouncing the Japanese authorities for evading the liquidation of its crimes on comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 The statement said that the council is set to establish a monument to peace in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul. The monument is meant to depict victims who met deaths after being forced into sexual slavery by the Japanese army.
					
					 The chief of Cabinet Secretary of Japan called for stopping the building of the monument, saying it will have negative impact on diplomatic activities, said the statement, adding:
					
					 This shows that the Japanese authorities feel somewhat uneasy abut the past crimes.
					
					 The Japanese government should not check the establishment of the monument but bear the legal responsibility for its past crimes and find a proper solution to it.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Mark Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Mark Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Suk
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Russia and Uruguay carried articles with photos of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero and woman commander of Mt. Paektu, to mark the 94th anniversary of her birth.
					
					 The Russian paper Nakhodkinski Rabochi on Dec.8 said that Kim Jong Suk was a prominent woman revolutionary who devoted all her life to the social emancipation of women and the development of women's movement.
					
					 She led the women step by step during the days of her underground activities and her participation in the military and political training for the final decisive battle for Korea's liberation, it noted.
					
					 It also cited concrete facts to show that she aroused the women to turn out in the drive to build a new country while aiding President Kim Il Sung in his activities after the national liberation.
					
					 Her feats for development of the women's movement will remain long with socialist Korea registering victory after victory, the paper added.
					
					 The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on Dec. 6 elaborated on the contributions she made to national liberation and the building of a new society.

articles.title: Significant Days of DPRK Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Significant Days of DPRK Marked Abroad
						

					Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries on December 5 and 6 to mark the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero. They included meeting, book and photo exhibitions, film show in India, seminar in Colombia, lecture in Indonesia and ceremony of opening the week of photo exhibition in Nigeria.
					
					 On display in their venues were books and photos on the Songun revolutionary leadership feats of Kim Jong Il and photos introducing the Korean people in the efforts to build socialism.
					
					 Korean film "Arms of Korea" was displayed at the film show.
					
					 B.C. Gupta, chairman of the Juche Idea Study Society of Indian Delhi, said that Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il has put the defence capability of the DPRK on the highest level for the past 20 years.
					
					 The Korean people will surely win victory in the efforts to build socialism and achieve national reunification as they have the invincible revolutionary armed forces commanded by Kim Jong Il, the speaker stressed.
					
					 Jairo Gonzalez Trujillo, president of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia, and other speakers noted that Kim Jong Il has defended the dignity and sovereignty of the country and wisely led socialist construction with his original Songun politics. 
					
					 They praised the feats performed by Kim Jong Suk for the Korean revolution and the movement for women's emancipation. 
					
					 Baharudin Basir, director of P.T. Dwi Mitra Perkasa of Indonesia, said the greatest feat of Kim Jong Suk is that she brought up Kim Jong Il to be heir to President Kim Il Sung and the sun of Juche.
					
					 The director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria said that the peace of the Korean Peninsula and stability of Northeast Asia would be steadfastly guaranteed as long as there is the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Russian FM Gives Warning to NATO over Georgian Issue
articles.content:
Russian FM Gives Warning to NATO over Georgian Issue
						

					 Moscow, December 14 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, some days ago, warned NATO of its attempt to inveigle Georgia into it.
					
					 In its recently released communique NATO reportedly listed Georgia as one of the nations desirous of NATO membership.
					
					 Georgia made an indiscreet decision in August 2008 because it had already been announced that the country would surely become a NATO member, Lavrov said.
					
					 He urged NATO not to instigate Georgia to repeat such an adventurous act voluntarily or involuntarily.

articles.title: Russian Official Concerned over Movements of Foreign Military Equipment
articles.content:
Russian Official Concerned over Movements of Foreign Military Equipment
						

					 Moscow, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Russian permanent representative to NATO expressed concern over movements of foreign military equipment.
					
					 Speaking at a meeting held some days ago, Dmitri Rogozin said he felt foreign military equipments were encircling Russia.
					
					 "Under such circumstances, Russia will seek a way to break the encirclement," he said.

articles.title: Russia Denounces West's Anti-Iran Approach
articles.content:
Russia Denounces West's Anti-Iran Approach 

					 Moscow, December 14 (KCNA) -- Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov on Friday criticized the approach of western countries towards the Islamic Republic of Iran. Talking live on the Russia-24 TV news channel, he reiterated that the anti-Iran sanctions are already on the track of extremism.
					
					 Moscow believes that the negotiations on Iran still have a potential, he said.

articles.title: Russia Rejects NATO's MD
articles.content:
Russia Rejects NATO's MD 

					 Moscow, December 14 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov denounced NATO for pressing for the establishment of the missile defense system in defiance of Russia.
					
					 He said NATO has been refusing to give written assurances that its missile defense system would not target Russia.
					
					 Progress cannot be expected in bilateral dialogue on the missile defense system unless NATO lends an ear to Russia, he argued, adding "Our legitimate request has not been taken into account".

articles.title: Satellite Launched in Russia
articles.content:
Satellite Launched in Russia

					 Moscow, December 14 (KCNA) -- Russia launched a relay satellite on Dec. 11.
					
					 The satellite loaded with Proton-M, a carrier rocket, blasted off from the Baikonur Space Launching Center to be successfully put on the preset orbit.

articles.title: Chinese, Russian Presidents Optimistic of Bilateral Cooperation
articles.content:
Chinese, Russian Presidents Optimistic of Bilateral Cooperation

					 Beijing, December 14 (KCNA) -- Chinese and Russian presidents sent congratulatory messages respectively to the 9th meeting of China-Russia committee for friendship, peace and development held in Beijing on Tuesday.
					
					 Hu Jintao appreciated the committee for making important contributions to deepening mutual understanding and friendship between the people of the two countries.
					
					 Both China and Russia decided to direct efforts to developing the all-round strategic cooperation partnership in which they trust and support each other on an equal footing and jointly enjoy prosperity, Hu said in the message. 
					
					 Dmitri Medvedev expressed the belief that the meeting would help further consolidate the social foundations of Russia-China relations, thus ushering in a new prospect in developing bilateral cooperation.

articles.title: China Rejects U.S. Interference
articles.content:
China Rejects U.S. Interference

					 Beijing, December 14 (KCNA) -- Liu Weimin, spokesman for the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, flatly denied the U.S. interference in the internal affairs of China in an interview on Tuesday.
					
					 As regards remarks taking issue with China made by high ranking officials of the U.S. Administration including the State secretary when giving a lecture on the human rights performance and freedom of Internet, the spokesman voiced the stand of China opposed to the interference in its internal affairs under the pretext of human rights.
					
					 The U.S. has no right to interfere in China's internal affairs and judicial sovereignty and it had better mind its own human right performance before telling others to do like this or that, Liu urged.

articles.title: Japan Launches Information-Gathering Satellite
articles.content:
Japan Launches Information-Gathering Satellite

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Japan is making desperate efforts to escalate spy activities over the DPRK.
					
					 "H-2A" rocket loaded with "radar 3", information gathering satellite, was launched at Tanegashima Space Center in Kagoshima Prefecture On Dec. 12. The mission of the satellite is to monitor military facilities in the DPRK.
					
					 This vividly shows that the Japanese reactionaries are running amuck to realize their wild ambition for reinvading the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Japan's Greenhouse Gas Emissions Up
articles.content:
Japan's Greenhouse Gas Emissions Up 

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Greenhouse gases equivalent to 1 256 million tons of carbon dioxide were emitted in Japan in fiscal 2010, up 3.9 percent from the year before, the Environment Ministry said Tuesday.

articles.title: Iran Rejects U.S. Groundless Judgment: FM Spokesman
articles.content:
Iran Rejects U.S. Groundless Judgment: FM Spokesman
						

					 Tehran, December 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Iranian Foreign Ministry on Dec. 11 rejected the U.S. groundless judgment.
					
					 A U.S. local court recently ruled that Iran is to blame for the bombing attacks on the U.S. embassies in Kenya and Tanzania ten years ago. He dismissed it as groundless accusations.
					
					 The judgment is another plot hatched by the U.S. administration against Iran, he said, adding: Through such moves the U.S. tries to retrieve their repeated failure in the Middle East.

articles.title: Palestinians Condemn Israeli Settlement Activities
articles.content:
Palestinians Condemn Israeli Settlement Activities

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Palestinian officials on Monday condemned the installation of an Israeli checkpoint and the approval of new settlement activities in East Jerusalem and the West Bank. Israeli authorities installed a permanent military checkpoint outside Shufat refugee camp, cutting it from East Jerusalem, which Palestinians demand as a future capital, witnesses said. 
					
					 Adnan Al-Hussini, head of Jerusalem's affairs in the Palestinian National Authority (PNA), told in a press interview that the checkpoint puts 50,000 Palestinians out of Jerusalem borders.
					
					 "This is a dedication of the occupation's policies that aim to drive out Palestinians from Jerusalem," he added.

articles.title: Brazilian Leader Ramps up Anti-Drug Pitch
articles.content:
Brazilian Leader Ramps up Anti-Drug Pitch

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff on Monday touted a recently-launched plan aimed at cracking down on drug trafficking and rehabilitating drug addicts. 
					
					 "We will guarantee care and treatment to addicts, who need support to beat their addiction. We will severely crack down on drug trafficking and organized crime in the entire country," she said in her weekly radio address.
					
					 Rousseff also said the government will get tougher on drug dealers and smash criminal gangs.
					
					 "We will fight criminal groups with increasing rigor, to prevent the entry of drugs into our country," she said.

articles.title: Belarus Criticizes OSCE Decision
articles.content:
Belarus Criticizes OSCE Decision

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A senior Belarus diplomat recently criticized the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) over its decision to stop all cooperation with the Belarus government, a media report said. 
					
					 The director of the Information Department of the Foreign Ministry said the decision adopted at a recent OSCE meeting was a very biased one prompted by its political demand.

articles.title: Protests Sweep across Italy against Austerity Measures
articles.content:
Protests Sweep across Italy against Austerity Measures

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Thousands of protesters took to the streets across Italy Monday to protest the austerity measures adopted by Prime Minister Mario Monti's emergency cabinet.
					
					 The demonstrators strongly called upon the authorities to cancel at once the unreasonable austerity measurers such as tax hike.

articles.title: Britain's Output Price Index Rises
articles.content:
Britain's Output Price Index Rises 

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Britain's output price index for home sales of manufactured products rose 5.4 percent in the year to November, according to the British Office for National Statistics.

articles.title: Australia's Exports Down
articles.content:
Australia's Exports Down
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Australia's exports of goods and services fell 49 million AU dollars (49.86 million U.S. dollars) to 27.3 billion AU dollars (27.78 billion U.S. dollars) in October, compared to the previous month, according to figures released on Monday from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

articles.title: Syria Refutes France's Charge
articles.content:
Syria Refutes France's Charge

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Syrian Foreign Ministry refuted France's groundless charge against Syria.
					
					France has charged that Syria was behind the injuries five French peace-keeping soldiers suffered in Lebanon on Sunday.
					
					 In a statement Monday the spokesman said the charge is nothing but a trite fabrication and slander against Syria.

articles.title: Steel Production Up in Iran
articles.content:
Steel Production Up in Iran
						

					 Tehran, December 14 (KCNA) -- The steel production of Iran increased by 10.6 percent in the first eight months of Iran's present year compared with the same period of Iran's past year.
					
					 This was reported by a newspaper of Iran on Dec. 11.

articles.title: Turkey's Current Account Deficit Stands at 4.2 Billion U.S. Dollars in October
articles.content:
Turkey's Current Account Deficit Stands at 4.2 Billion U.S. Dollars in October
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Turkey's current account deficit stood at 4.2 billion U.S. dollars in October, Turkish Statistics Institute said in an announcement on Monday.

articles.title: U.S. Federal Budget Deficit Reaches $137 Bln in November
articles.content:
U.S. Federal Budget Deficit Reaches $137 Bln in November

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The U.S. federal government reported a budget deficit of 137.3 billion dollars in November, the U.S. Treasury Department announced on Monday.

articles.title: Man Armed with Grenades Attacks Belgian City
articles.content:
Man Armed with Grenades Attacks Belgian City
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Four people were killed and 75 others were wounded as a man armed with grenades, a rifle and a pistol started a killing spree in the eastern Belgian town of Liege on Tuesday.
					
					 Reports said the attack began at about 12:30 p.m. when the 33-year-old man lobbed several grenades at the bus shelter in Place Saint-Lambert, a busy downtown square.
					
					 The man died along with two teenager boys and a 75-year-old woman. 
					
					 The injured included a two-year-old who was in serious condition, according to local hospital. Fifty-two of the injured have to receive medical care at local hospitals.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Mexico
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Mexico
						

					 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A 6.8-magnitude earthquake jolted Mexico City, Mexico on Dec. 10.
					
					 The epicenter was the southern area of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige Centro de Informacion de Musica Hana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige Centro de Informacion de Musica Hana

					Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el Centro de Informacion de Musica Hana.
					
					El centro, radicado en el reparto Thong-il, es la base de informacion artistica integral que colecciona, redacta y divulga los datos referentes a las musicas y las danzas de Corea y otros paises del mundo. 
					
					Recorriendo la biblioteca electronica de musicas, la sala de audicion multicanal y otros puntos del centro, el Dirigente dio conocimiento del estado de construccion y la gestion del centro.
					
					Evaluo altamente que el centro se construyo magnificamente de manera contemporanea al tratar influyentemente el exterior del centro a traves de la decoracion con piedras mediante el metodo de construccion en seco y al hacer bien la construccion del interior por lo multifuncional.
					
					Se mostro satisfecho de que la biblioteca  electronica de musica dotada de las instalaciones sofisticadas se haya acondicionado confortablemente conforme a  las caracteristicas de los especialistas de musicas y bailes y de las personas no personalizadas. 
					
					Escuchando las musicas en la sala de audicion multicanal equipada con modernas instalaciones acusticas estereofonicas, el senalo que la sala se ha  acondicionado excelentemente para que surtiera el mismo efecto como escuchar la musica en el teatro.
					
					Para gestionar bien el centro, hay que coleccionar muchas obras artisticas, incluyendo las coreanas y las celebres del mundo, destaco. 
					
					El centro debe contar con todos los datos artisticos como la grabacion de nueva cancion, la partitura y los libros de musicas y danzas que se publican en el pais, dijo y agrego que enviara todas las piezas musicales coleccionadas sistematicamente por si mismo durante decenas de anos de su direccion sobre la revolucion y la construccion para que nuestro pueblo pueda escucharlas y utilizarlas ampliamente.
					
					El mismo dia, el Dirigente recorrio el terreno de produccion de la compania mixta de aparatos electronicos Hana acondicionada en el segundo piso del centro.
					
					Pasando revista a varios lugares, analizo en detalles la capacidad productiva, las variedades y calidades de los productos.
					
					Se mostro muy satisfecho de que la citada compania produjera mucho diferentes articulos de uso cultural al acondicionar el proceso productivo de aparatos electronicos cuya capacidad es de centenares de miles al ano.
					
					Contemplando el DVD ajustandose en el proceso productivo en cadena, evaluo altamente que los productos son de calidad alta y absolutamente perfectos.
					
					Particularmente, aprecio altamente el DVD portatil con funcion de TV.
					
					Cercioro el estado de la investigacion y el desarrollo de nuevos productos electronicos y evaluo el extraordinario espiritu creativo de los funcionarios y empleados de la compania quienes despliegan con vigor la lucha por conquistar tecnologias de punta.
					
					Cada dia se aumenta la demanda del pueblo coreano sobre los articulos de uso cultural como DVD, senalo y puntualizo que la compania debe producir mas productos electronicos de diferentes variedades.
					
					En esta ocasion el Dirigente fue acompanado por Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buro Politico y jefa de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Pak To Chun, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Jae Il, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, y Kwon Hyok Bong, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige Supermercado del Area de Kwangbok
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige Supermercado del Area de Kwangbok
						

					Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dirigio en el terreno el Supermercado del Area de Kwangbok, en visperas de su apertura.
					
					Gracias a la directa iniciativa y gran benevolencia del Dirigente quien siempre presta atencion al fomento de bienestar y mejora de vida del pueblo, el Gran Almacen de Kwangbok construido en octubre de 1991 se ha convertido en el Supermercado del Area de Kwangbok.
					
					Este Supermercado es la base de servicio comercial en que al realizar la informatizacion y la digitalizacion de todas las actividades administrativas desde el almacenaje hasta la venta de los articulos, garantiza la exactitud y rapidez en el servicio y brinda al maximo las comodidades de los compradores.
					
					En el Supermercado cuya area arquitectonica total llega a mas de 12 mil 700 metros cuadrados, esta lleno de utensilios domesticos, articulos electronicos, confites, leche, te, salsa y pasta de soya, aceite y otros alimentos, ropas infantiles, juguetes, ropas coreanas, toallas, mantas acolchadas, ropas interiores y otros articulos fibrosos.
					
					Recorriendo mostradores de 1, 2 y 3 escalas, el Dirigente hizo conocimiento detallado de las variedades de articulos, el estado de exhibicion y plan de venta de las mercancias.
					
					Dijo que vitrinas, mostradores, medios de exhibir y otras instalaciones y equipos estan bien instalados para la conservacion y venta de los articulos y  conforme a demanda de los clientes y se mostro muy satisfecho de que se haya acondicionado magnificamente la base de servicio comercial a contribuir a la mejora de vida del pueblo.
					
					Gracias al establecimiento de Supermercado se puede satisfacer mas la creciente demanda del pueblo sobre los articulos, senalo el Dirigente y tomo las medidas necesarias a las actividades de servicio del Supermercado diciendo que deben ofrecer, cueste lo que cueste, todos los que demanda el pueblo.
					
					El Dirigente presento las tareas que se presentan en el servicio del Supermercado.
					
					La esencia del comercio socialista reside en librar todas las actividades para servir al pueblo, razon por la cual las ramas interesadas deben realizar la suministracion de los articulos con la posicion de responsabilizarse de la vida del pueblo y vender a tiempo los articulos necesarios con urgencia para el pueblo, de manera que garanticen las comodidades de vida del pueblo.
					
					Ofrecer lo mejor al pueblo es la inconmovible voluntad y decision del partido. Los funcionarios deben ser fieles servidores que siempre piensan en el pueblo y se preocupan por su vida.
					
					Tienen que empenarse por vender los articulos al pueblo antes de exportarlos al mercado extranjero.
					
					Le acompanaron Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buro Politico y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Pak To Chun y Choe Ryong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP, secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Jae Il, Pak Pong Ju y Han Kwang Sang, primeros subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Mujeres extranjeras en Corea rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Mujeres extranjeras en Corea rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Suk

					Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 94o aniversario del natalicio de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, las mujeres de las embajadas de varios paises y las representaciones de organizaciones internacionales acreditadas en Corea guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de ella tras depositar ofrenda floral ante su busto en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong.

articles.title: Acto central por 50o de sistema de trabajo de Taean
articles.content:
Acto central por 50o de sistema de trabajo de Taean 

					Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 en el Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean el acto central por el 50o aniversario de la creacion del sistema del trabajo de Taean por el Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Asistieron a la ocasion Choe Yong Rim, Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, Thae Jong Su, los funcionarios de los organos del partido, la administracion y la economia, los funcionarios, innovadores laborales y otros trabajadores de la ciudad de Nampho y dicho complejo.
					
					El informe de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					En diciembre del 50 (1961) de la Era Juche, el Presidente creo un sistema del trabajo de Taean, lo cual fue un evento historico que preparo el periodo de viraje trascendental en el impulso victorioso de la causa de la independencia de las masas populares, la del socialismo al consolidar el regimen economico establecido en nuestro pais y poner de pleno manifiesto la superioridad del socialismo.
					
					Tal sistema sirve de prototipo de la forma de administracion de la economia socialista que refleja con mas exactitud la demanda legitima del desarrollo de la economia socialista y de la bandera revolucionaria a ser materializada cabalmente en todos los dominios de la economia nacional durante todo el periodo historico de la construccion socialista.
					
					La esencia revolucionaria del sistema de trabajo de Taean reside en el sistema de de trabajo del Juche que materializo la inmortal idea Juche y la linea de masas del partido en la administracion economica.
					
					El sistema se caracteriza por el sistema de administracion economica centrado en los hombres, en una palabra, en las masas populares, quienes gestionan la economia siendo verdaderas duenas de la administracion de esta.
					
					La conversion de Corea, secularmente atrasada, en una potencia socialista independiente, autosostenida y autodefensiva, se debe a la destacada y probada direccion del Presidente quien creo el sistema de administracion economica apropiado a Corea y lo materializo a cabalidad en todas las esferas de la vida social.
					
					Hoy, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il hereda de modo brillante la idea del Presidente en materia de la administracion economica jucheana y sus hazanas. 
					
					Todos deben enfocar de continuo las fuerzas para hacer racionalmente la administracion economica conforme a los principios socialistas e interese del pueblo adhiriendose con mas firmeza a la posicion jucheana.
